Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
measly \mea"sly\ (m[=e]"zly), a. 1. Infected with measles. [1913 Webster]
2. (Zo["o]l.) Containing larval tapeworms; -- said of pork and beef. [1913 Webster]
3. Contemptibly small in quantity; meager; absurdly insufficient or bad; as, a measly few dollars for all that work. [PJC]

measly adj : contemptibly small in amount; "a measly tip"; "the company donated a miserable $100 for flood relief"; "a paltry wage"; "almost depleted his miserable store of dried beans" [syn: {miserable}, {paltry}] [also: {measliest}, {measlier}]
